subhead: During a visit to Colombia, French foreign affairs minister Jean-Noël Barrot unveiled a 'battle plan' to fight organized crime. Colombian President Gustavo Petro has called on the international community to consider legalizing cocaine as a way to weaken drug traffickers.

title: When a Syrian author becomes the voice of Gaza's survivors
subhead: 'A Memory of Annihilation,' the latest book by Samar Yazbek, brings together a striking series of testimonies from survivors of the hell in Gaza.

title: Previously unknown Renoir painting sells for €1.8 million at auction
subhead: The oil painting by French impressionist painter Auguste Renoir of his toddler son Jean had never before been exhibited or sold.

subhead: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

title: France's cultural landmarks enter a time of costly makeovers
subhead: Lack of regular upkeep and the effects of climate change have forced many cultural institutions to undertake massive renovation projects, with costs expected to reach €5 billion over the next 10 years.

title: 'I told him about my day in real time': The couples who can't stop texting on WhatsApp
subhead: While couples in France exchange an average of nine text messages a day, some go far beyond, updating their partner in real time about every event in their day-to-day lives. Is this constant connection a sign of profound intimacy, or a need for control?
